verses.roman:
tāṅre āśvāsiyā prabhu karilā gamana
kṛtamālāya snāna kari āilā durvaśana

synonyms: tāṅre āśvāsiyā—assuring him; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; karilā gamana—departed; kṛtamālāya—in the river known as Kṛtamālā; snāna kari—bathing; āilā—came; durvaśana—to Durvaśana.
translation: After thus assuring the brāhmaṇa, Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu proceeded further into southern India and finally arrived at Durvaśana, where He bathed in the river Kṛtamālā.

purport.content: Presently the Kṛtamālā River is known as the river Bhāgāi. This river has three tributaries, named Surulī, Varāha-nadī and Baṭṭilla-guṇḍu. The river Kṛtamālā is also mentioned in Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam (11.5.39) by the sage Karabhājana.
